# hasUnifiedMemory

**Instance Property**

A Boolean value that indicates whether the GPU shares all of its memory with the CPU.

## Declaration

```swift
var hasUnifiedMemory: Bool { get }
```

## Discussion

A GPU with unified memory ([doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/Swift/true]) is typically an integrated GPU. A GPU with dedicated memory ([doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/Swift/false]) may take additional time to synchronize managed resources or copy data into private GPU resources.

## Checking a GPU device’s memory

- **currentAllocatedSize**: The total amount of memory, in bytes, the GPU device is using for all of its resources.
- **recommendedMaxWorkingSetSize**: An approximation of how much memory, in bytes, this GPU device can allocate without affecting its runtime performance.
- **maxTransferRate**: The highest theoretical rate, in bytes per second, the system can copy between system memory and the GPU’s dedicated memory (VRAM).
